headline.main: Harvard's Prize Catch, a Delphic Postcolonialist

lead_paragraph: At Harvard University, the acquisition of Homi K. Bhabha from the University of Chicago this fall is regarded as a major coup, as if Sammy Sosa had defected to the Boston Red Sox. ''It was our dream to get Homi Bhabha,'' said Henry Louis Gates Jr., chairman of the Afro-American studies department, where Mr. Bhabha will begin teaching in the spring. Reaction in the English department, where Mr. Bhabha will be spending the bulk of his time, was just as enthusiastic. ''He's manifestly one of the most distinguished cultural theorists of the postcolonial and diasporic experience in the world,'' said Lawrence Buell, the department chairman.
